sense.name: impose as an order; require necessarily
sense.examples: Whenever my mother visits, she dictates the menu for every meal. The Communist Party dictated important decisions to judges, often through surreptitious phone calls. Political objectives, rather than humanitarian, dictated the refugee policy. Schools will dismiss at the regular time, unless the weather dictates otherwise.

sense.name: say out loud for another to record
sense.examples: She dictated a cable to her niece in New York. Blakely dictated his memoires to his secretary. I would rather dictate into a tape recorder than write out notes.
